RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 37. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JACKYSINTHECASTLE came away awkwardly, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path of the turn and dug in through the stretch to take over the final strides. WISHING FOR SPRING chased inside, raced close off the rail on the turn, dueled to the front mid-stretch but was caught in the final strides. SWISS HORIZON was hustled for the lead and set a pressured pace, rounded the turn near the rail, gave up the lead mid-stretch and relented the final sixteenth. BOWMANS LAZY GIRL gave chase, rounded the turn in the three path and flattened in the lane. PRETTY CASTLE bobbled leaving the gate, picked up the chase inside, rounded the turn at the rail and showed little in the lane. TRACE ESTATE broke out to make contact with. ONLY ROMANCE, gave chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn about the five path. The latter became a bit anxious in the gate and was bumped at the start, gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Wishing for Spring
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,off rail turn,up 1/16,caught final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Jackysinthecastle
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,chased,4p turn,dug in lane,up final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 16900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE SEPTEMBER 23, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since September 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, al lowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORTES gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn, dug in for the lead later yards and ran clear under the wire. TRUE HEIRESS steadied on the chute then gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail, eased out leaving the turn, finished well to take second the final strides and was gaining on the winner. MS HEADLEY pressured the pace, raced in the three path of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. WILLOW MOON set a pressured pace, ran at the rail on the turn, gave up the lead mid-stretch and flattened later yards. BLACK PANDA gave chase, rounded the turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. SWEETONTHEGENTS chased through the backstretch, raced in the five path of the turn and showed little in the lane. EVER SO D'WILD chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened. SUPER WILDCAT saved ground on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Sweetonthegents
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 45. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VAN HOOK broke awkwardly, ducked in and made contact with STOWE PATROL leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn in the four path and steadily closed in the lane to get up the final strides. The latter was bumped leaving the gate, rushed up for the lead and set a pressured pace, contested even terms nearest the rail on the turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was caught in the final strides. XPOSED SECRET pressured the pace, contested even terms two deep on the turn but flattened later yards. JUJU ON DA BEAT gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. LAURA'S GRAND chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path then flattened later yards. S S CASINO GIRL came away awkwardly and ducked in at the break, gave close early chase inside, rounded the turn near the rail but showed little in the lane. SWEETSTREETDREAMS was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: S S Casino Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward,ducked in break,chased inside,rail turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Stowe Patrol
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,set pressured pace,rail turn,caught final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Xposed Secret
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressured pace,even terms 2d turn,flattened later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 23 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Consid ered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GHOSTLY SQUALL contested the pace with a slim lead, rounded the turn at the rail and dug in determinedly to hold off the game stretch challenge of GAVINERA, who pressured the pace three wide through the backstretch, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn and dueled gamely to the finish. ELLIES LIL CASTLE chased the pace through the backstretch, raced five wide on the turn, finished evenly and cleared third in later yards. RUNNING FREE chased inside, raced close at the rail on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. SHUTUPN'KISSME chased, raced in the three path of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. CEDAR'S WISH dwelt at the start, gave only distant chase and rounded the turn about the four path. SHENANDOAH CAT pressured the pace two deep while between horses through the backstretch, but dropped back at the quarter pole and faded on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Ghostly Squall
ENTRY.COMMENT: contested edge inside,rail turn,determined stretch effort

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REJOICE accelerated to the front approaching the seven sixteenths pole and rated the pace, came under pressure at the quarter pole, rounded the turn near the rail and held well under steady stretch handling. FRONT DANCER had a brief early lead then gave chase, raced close off the rail on the turn and held on for second. BODYSLAM gave chase, rounded the turn in the four and five paths, finished well and just missed second. GLASTONBURY bobbled at the start, picked up the chase inside, raced off the rail on the turn, eased out into the lane and flattened stride. ALWAYS GET REVENGE lunged outward and made contact with Shameless Appeal then chased inside, steadied at the rail leaving the five sixteenths pole then drifted through the turn. SWIFT DANCER gave chase inside then faded at the rail on the turn. CRUSH 'N RUN gave chase then flattened in the six path of the turn. SHAMELESS APPEAL was bumped leaving the gate, chased the pace off the rail then drifted through the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Glastonbury
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled break,chased inside,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Swift Dancer
ENTRY.OWNER: Aguilar Jose B and Gallegos Jose M

ENTRY.NAME: Rejoice
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 7/16,rated pace,pressured 1/4,rail turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Front Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: briefly led,chased,close off rail turn,held on 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAKE THE WAY CLEAR settled in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and closed to the front two deep approaching the head of the lane, dug in under steady encouragement and just lasted. LIGHTNING LAD saved ground on the first turn, bid into the backstretch and steadily improved, rounded the far turn about the five path, cleared second mid-stretch, finished well and just missed. PLAYBOY ROY became a bit edgy in the gate and saved ground on the first turn, started a bid from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and ran evenly in the lane. CHERRYS CROSS ducked out leaving the gate and entered the first turn about the six path, left the turn inside and picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and flattened inside the eighth pole. FRONT PORCH raced well off the pace in the four path the first turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and ran evenly in the lane. GORUN raced well off the pace and off the rail the opening turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and ran evenly in the stretch. GANDHI'S ORION raced with the early leader, took the lead two deep at the nine sixteenths pole and rated the pace, came under pressure toward the five sixteenths pole, was met at the rail approaching the head of the lane and weakened in the lane. DAKOTA BOY raced with the pace inside, gave chase from the nine sixteenths pole but faded past the five sixteenths. THATZA ALPHA stalked in the four path the first turn then faded after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Gorun
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,off rail,chased 7/16,4p far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Front Porch
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 4p,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Playboy Roy
ENTRY.COMMENT: edgy gate,saved ground,bid 7/16,3p far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Cherrys Cross
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,6p early,chased 7/16,rail far turn,flatten lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE SEPTEMBER 23, 2022. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4, 000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SECRET AFFIRMATION pressured the pace inside, took the nod nearing the quarter pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn then dug in under steady encouragement to hold on. INCLUDE THE BEAST set a pressured pace through the backstretch, was met approaching the quarter pole, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn and dug in gamely to the wire. SHACKABOOM pressured the pace, contested the turn three wide but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. CHARM WEAVER steadied at the start then gave chase, raced two deep on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. CHEESE LOUISE chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened later yards. NANCYSAIDSO gave chase, rounded the turn in the three and four paths and ran evenly in the lane. MY EXPENSIVE GIFT gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn then angled out nearing the head of the lane. ONEPRETTYTHING came away rank then gave distant chase, rounded the turn in the four and five paths, was carried out approaching the top of the lane and showed little more. CAPTAIN SAM was unprepared for the break and lost any chance.

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Affirmation
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,nod near 1/4,edge rail turn,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Oneprettything
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank break,distant chase,4& 5p turn,carried out 1/8,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Include the Beast
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met near 1/4,close 2d turn,gamely lane

ENTRY.NAME: Nancysaidso
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners O f A Race Since February 23 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 23 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DULCIMER DAME rated a slim lead inside then kept the edge over SENECA ROCKS leaving the three eighths pole, came under pressure at the rail midway on the far turn and held well under steady stretch handling. The latter stalked two deep, challenged leaving the three eighths pole and raced close two deep on the far turn, but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. WILL OR WON'T rated off the early pace about the three path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. MADY ROSE settled off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. GOLDEN SWEETS rated off the pace inside on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Dulcimer Dame
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,kept edge from 3/8,pressured turn,held well

ENTRY.NAME: Mady Rose
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Dunloe Ventures LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,chased 1/2,3p far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Will Or Won't
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated off pace 3p,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,evenly lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Maiden Claiming Purse 13300. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SLOE GIN BIZ rated close off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole and remained close through the far turn, dug in under steady handling leaving the turn and took the nod the final strides. VOICE OF NOW rated close in the four path the first turn then took the lead three wide nearing the half mile pole, came under pressure at the five sixteenths, contested the advantage at the rail on the far turn and dug in under steady stretch encouragement, but gave up the nod in the final strides. A THOUSAND IDOLS rated close inside on the first turn, angled out a path in the vicinity of the seven sixteenths pole, picked up the chase from the three eighths, raced at the rail on the far turn and finished well. DADDY Z rounded the opening turn in the six path, left the turn outside and picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the four path of the far turn but flattened in the lane. FLASH OF DAY settled off the rail on the first turn, was forced out steadying in the vicinity of the seven sixteenths pole, recovered stride and gave chase from the three eighths, raced off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. SPEIGHTY SENSE raced with the pace two deep, gave chase from the half mile pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, eased out leaving the turn but showed little further. LIGHT WORK saved ground well off the pace and showed little response through the backstretch. TIZNOW TIME raced with the early pace inside, gave chase leaving the first turn but faded through the backstretch. TO LIVE IS TO LOVE rounded the opening turn in the five path, left the turn outside and showed little response. The Stewards reviewed a claim of foul against the rider of A Thousand Idols for interference in the vicinity of the seven sixteenths pole, lodged by the rider of Flash Of Day, though, took no action.

ENTRY.NAME: Flash of Day
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,forced out steadying 7/16,chased,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: A Thousand Idols
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,angle out7/16,chased3/8,rail turn,finish well

ENTRY.NAME: Sloe Gin Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,nod fnal strdes

ENTRY.NAME: Speighty Sense
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,chased past 1/2,rail far turn,eased out 1/8,little lane

ENTRY.NAME: Voice of Now
ENTRY.OWNER: Mary E. Eppler Racing Stable, Inc.
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close 4p 1st turn,up 3wd near 1/2,rail far turn,nipped late
